name: biobb_mem CHAP
title: Wrapper of the Channel Annotation Package (CHAP) for analyzing pore geometry, hydrophobicity, and hydration state in protein channels and other macromolecular structures.
description: CHAP finds pores in biological macromolecules like ion channels and determines the hydration state of these permeation pathways. It can operate on both individual structures and on molecular dynamics trajectories. For more information, see the CHAP documentation.

b.description: First frame (in picoseconds) to read from trajectory.

e.description: Last frame (in picoseconds) to read from trajectory.

df.description: Only use frame if t MOD dt == first time (in picoseconds).

sel_pathway.description: Reference group that defines the permeation pathway (usually 'Protein').

sel_solvent.description: Group of small particles to calculate density of (usually 'Water').

out_filename.description: Base file name for output files without file extension.

out_num_points.description: Number of spatial sample points that are written to the JSON output file.

out_extrap_dist.description: Extrapolation distance beyond the pathway endpoints for both JSON and OBJ output.

out_grid_dist.description: Controls the sampling distance of vertices on the pathway surface which are subsequently interpolated to yield a smooth surface. Very small values may yield visual artifacts.

out_vis_tweak.description: Visual tweaking factor that controls the smoothness of the pathway surface in the OBJ output. Varies between -1 and 1 (exclusively), where larger values result in a smoother surface. Negative values may result in visualisation artifacts.

out_detailed.description: If true, CHAP will write detailed per-frame information to a newline delimited JSON file including original probe positions and spline parameters. This is mostly useful for debugging.

pf_method.description: Path finding method. The default inplane_optim implements the algorithm used in the HOLE programme, where the position of a probe sphere is optimised in subsequent parallel planes so as to maximise its radius. The alternative cylindrical simply uses a cylindrical volume as permeation pathway.

pf_vdwr_database.description: Database of van-der-Waals radii to be used in pore finding.

pf_vdwr_fallback.description: Fallback van-der-Waals radius for atoms that are not listed in van-der-Waals radius database. Unless this is set to a positive value, an error will be thrown if a pathway-forming atom has no associated van-der-Waals radius in the database.

pf_vdwr_json.description: JSON file with user defined van-der-Waals radii. Will be ignored unless -pf-vdwr-database is set to 'user'.

pf_align_method.description: Method for aligning pathway coordinates across time steps.

pf_max_probe_steps.description: Maximum number of steps the probe is moved in either direction.

pf_sel_ipp.description: Selection of atoms whose COM will be used as initial probe position. If not set, the selection specified with 'sel-pathway' will be used.

pf_init_probe_pos.description: Initial position of probe in probe-based pore finding algorithms. If set explicitly, it will overwrite the COM-based initial position set with the ippSelflag.

pf_chan_dir_vec.description: Channel direction vector. Will be normalised to unit vector internally.

pf_cutoff.description: Cutoff for distance searches in path finding algorithm. A value of zero or less means no cutoff is applied. If unset, an appropriate cutoff is determined automatically.

sa_seed.description: Seed used in pseudo random number generation for simulated annealing. If not set explicitly, a random seed is used.

sa_max_iter.description: Number of cooling iterations in one simulated annealing run.

sa_step.description: Step length factor used in candidate generation.

nm_max_iter.description: Number of Nelder-Mead simplex iterations in path finding algorithm.

nm_init_shift.description: Distance of vertices in initial Nelder-Mead simplex.

pm_pl_margin.description: Margin for determining pathway lining residues. A residue is considered to be pathway lining if it is no further than the local path radius plus this margin from the pathway's centre line.

pm_pf_sel.description: Distance of vertices in initial Nelder-Mead simplex.

de_method.description: Method used for estimating the probability density of the solvent particles along the permeation pathway.

de_res.description: Spatial resolution of the density estimator. In case of a histogram, this is the bin width, in case of a kernel density estimator, this is the spacing of the evaluation points.

de_bandwidth.description: Bandwidth for the kernel density estimator. Ignored for other methods. If negative or zero, bandwidth will be determined automatically to minimise the asymptotic mean integrated squared error (AMISE).

de_bw_scale.description: Scaling factor for the band width. Useful to set a bandwidth relative to the AMISE-optimal value.

de_eval_cutoff.description: Evaluation range cutoff for kernel density estimator in multiples of bandwidth. Ignored for other methods. Ensures that the density falls off smoothly to zero outside the data range.

hydrophob_database.description: Database of hydrophobicity scale for pore forming residues.

hydrophob_fallback.description: Fallback hydrophobicity for residues in the pathway defining group. If unset, residues missing in the database will cause an error."

hydrophob_json.description: JSON file with user defined hydrophobicity scale. Will be ignored unless -hydrophobicity-database is set to 'user'.

binary_path.description: Path to the CHAP executable binary.

restart.description: Do not execute if output files exist.

sandbox_path.description: Parent path to the sandbox directory.
